sen.j: 様々な公的行事で雅楽を演奏すること、また演奏者を養成することが職務である。
sen.e: Its duty was to play gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music which was introduced from China to Japan) at various public events and to train gagaku players.
sen.cmt: 行11で、雅楽が海外音楽として説明されているので、ここでは雅楽を用語集の訳語 ancient Japanese court dance and music に which was introduced from China to Japan を付け加えました。

sen.j: 演奏者として歌師・舞師・笛師・楽師が設置された。
sen.e: Players were divided into groups of utanoshi (poet), mainoshi (dancer), fuenoshi (flute player) and gakushi (musician).

sen.j: このうち前三者は倭楽（在来音楽）を、後者は雅楽（海外音楽）を担当した。
sen.e: The former three groups played yamatogaku (ancient Japanese music) (pre-existing music) and the latter one group played gagaku (foreign music).

sen.j: 楽師は令制では唐・新羅・高麗（高句麗）・百済及び呉楽である伎楽・腰鼓に分かれてそれぞれの音楽を担当した。
sen.e: Gakushis (musicians) were divided into groups of Tang, Shiragi, Korai (Kokuri), Kudara, and gigaku and kurezutsumi which were kuregaku, the music in Go, and they played each music under the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: 入力済みの訳語は、唐 - to、新羅 - shinra、高麗 - koma 伎楽 - ginogaku となっていましたが、それぞれTang, Shiragi, Korai、gigaku （伎楽師の場合は、ginogakushi と読むと思います）に訂正しました。
sen.e: Gakushis (musicians) were divided into groups of Tang, Shiragi, Korai (Kokuri), Kudara, and gigaku and kurezutsumi which were kuregaku, the music in Go, and they played each music under the Ritsuryo system.

Gakushis (musicians) were divided into groups of Tang, Silla, Goryeo (Goguryeo), Paekche and gigaku and kurezutsumi which were kuregaku, the music in Wo, and they played each music under the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: 唐・新羅・高麗（高句麗）・百済→Shiragi, Korai (Kokuri), Kudaraは日本語読みのため、Silla, Goryeo (Goguryeo), Paekcheに修正、およびGo→Woに修正 (参照: 英辞郎 on the WEB、http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus/deta/g/gigaku.htm)

sen.j: 明治維新後、雅楽寮は楽所と統合されるなどの紆余曲折を経て宮内省式部職楽部（がくぶ）に改組され（1908年）、現在の宮内庁にそのまま引き継がれる。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, with some bumps and detours such as being integrated into the gakuso, Utaryo was reorganized into Shikibushoku Gakubu (Music Department of Imperial Household Agency) in 1908 and has taken over by the present Imperial Household Agency as it was.
